content.newsInsight: UK just freed 90 prisoners by mistake since April. Everyone's debating prison reform. Wrong conversation. When your error rate on prisoner releases hits double digits, you're not having a justice problem. You're having a data architecture problem that happens to involve humans in cages.
content.patternInsight: You're still reading. That already puts you ahead.
content.intelligenceExample: The UK prisoner release errors, for example. We read that and our mind goes to: what other critical systems are running on the same broken data infrastructure, and which one fails catastrophically next?
